qas.question: Where the elections of 2010 conducted fairly in Burma?

answers.text: allegations of polling station irregularities were raised

qas.question: Were the results of the 2010 elections accepted by the United Nations?

answers.text: the United Nations (UN) and a number of Western countries condemned the elections as fraudulent.

qas.question: What is the name that Burma held before 2010?

context: The goal of the Burmese constitutional referendum of 2008, held on 10 May 2008, is <a3_0>the creation of a "discipline-flourishing democracy"<a3_0/>. As part of the referendum process, the name of the country was changed from the "<a2_0>Union of Myanmar<a2_0/>" to the "Republic of the Union of Myanmar", and general elections were held under the new constitution in 2010. Observer accounts of the 2010 election describe the event as mostly peaceful; however, <a0_0>allegations of polling station irregularities were raised<a0_0/>, and <a1_0>the United Nations (UN) and a number of Western countries condemned the elections as fraudulent.
